CLEVELAND , Ohio - Michael Giorgio , the CFO of Suarez Corporation Industries and right - hand man to the company 's owner , Ben Suarez , pleaded guilty this morning to seven federal campaign financing charges .

A0: The plea bargain reached with prosecutors
RelatedSentence: The plea bargain reached with prosecutors requires Giorgio to testify against Suarez if the North Canton entrepreneur decides to present his case for innocence to a federal jury .

RelatedSentence: The plea bargain calls for Giorgio to receive from 2-1 / 2 to 3-1 / 2 years in prison , and up to a $ 250,000 fine , depending on his level of cooperation with prosecutors .
The plea bargain calls for Giorgio to receive from 2-1 / 2 to 3-1 / 2 years in prison , and up to a $ 250,000 fine , depending on his level of cooperation with prosecutors .

Suarez , 72 , and Giorgio , 62 , of Cuyahoga Falls , are charged with funneling more than $ 200,000 in illegal campaign contributions to Republican candidates U.S. Rep. Jim Renacci and Ohio Treasurer Josh Mandel in 2012 .

According to the indictments , Suarez and Giorgio enlisted Suarez company employees and their wives to act as straw donors by illegally writing campaign contribution checks with no expectation of having to pay back the company loans .

According to the indictments , Suarez and Giorgio enlisted Suarez company employees and their wives to act as straw donors by illegally writing campaign contribution checks with no expectation of having to pay back the company loans .

A1: not guilty to charges of conspiracy
RelatedSentence: Suarez , Giorgio and the company previously pleaded not guilty to charges of conspiracy to violate campaign finance laws , of making campaign contributions in the names of another , of making illegal corporate contributions , of making false statements , of conspiracy and obstruction of justice .
